brief.content-text:
The diagram depicts using the Server Message Block (SMB) protocol to share files between an SMB client and an SMB server. A shared resources box shows a Windows Explorer directory structure and a printer. A list next to the box includes:
- File systems
- Printers
- Mail slots
- API's

An SMB client sends an SMB request to obtain access to the server's shared resources, which include folders and a printer. The server sends an SMB response.

The caption text states: SMB is a client-server, request-response protocol. Servers can make their resources available to clients on the network.
